Subject: Fortran - problem with meanmolarmass()
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=186652637; y=9GjjX2O3lTLgcDLGCbD4Tc5MpGucQOI3Rk4geIWkra3b0MF3aQ4N

Dear Cantera group,

I am working on channel-flow simulations with DASSL, coupled to Cantera.
The command meanmolarmass() returns a value of 0.0000E+00 but if I take 
the ratio of, say, cp_mole()/cp_mass() it does return the proper value.

I'm running on Linux, using the demo_ftnlib.cpp provided with the source 
code. I have looked through the header files under 
/usr/local/include/cantera but have been unable to find where 
meanMolecularWeight() is defined. It is certainly used to calculate 
molar properties with no problem, but I can't figure out why 
meanmolarmass() is not giving the proper value.

Is anyone out there using Cantera in Fortran?
Thanks,
Michael
